channel.title: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?
channel.description: [poll type=regular public=true] * Very serious (career or likely career). * slightly serious(obsessive hobby). * kinda serious (normal hobby) * Not very serious (slight pastime). * Not serious (could care less). [/poll]

item.title: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
It may be better that you work on both, you think you can make it in music.
People are looking for “hot, new acts,” and if you wait too long, you might now be “new.” I’m sure you’ll be hot , but you may not be new.
Does that make sense?

item.title: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Side note:

When I say “one app is not enough,” I don’t mean one app is not enough to make music.
Auxy, Groovebox (Novation), GarageBand are great, but they will get stale. Creativity doesn’t come when you do the same thing. It comes when you try new things.
That’s what I mean, so please don’t get offended.

Read full topic

item.source: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?

item.title: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
If you’ve got a passion for music, invest in it.

Invest time:
Spend time learning. Go research things. Talk to people in the industry. Learn gear, and get more software.

Invest money:
Buy yourself some gear, and more software. One app is not enough.
Invest in some marketing, and branding knowledge, and put it into practice.

Invest energy:
Practice ALL THE TIME. Try new things.
Go out to clubs, concerts, raves, and (ugh ) festivals, and see whats up.
Engage with your peers. Not peers that are on the same level as you. Find people who can uplift you and your knowledge.

Making a career out of music (or art in general) aint easy. It takes work, blood, sweat, and tears, drive, and passion.

Read full topic

item.source: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?

item.title: [POLL] How serious are you about your music?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I’d need something between ‘Very serious’ and ‘slightly serious’.

Less than a (main) career, but more than a hobby.

Over the next couple of years, I’ll be pushing to develop it as a serious side-project generating its own income.
Not my main career*, but proper releases, etc… some as the release artist, while some as the writer/co-producer, but not the release artist. (Not ghost producing, but writing tracks/songs that sell on the song market to be re-produced and released by established and emerging performers.)

* though never say never

Read full topic
